job_title: Technical Theatre Coordinator in San Marcos, CA

The CCE staff's union is strong and helps aid in all Campus-wide staff support. There are good benefits for all employees, retirement and plenty of holidays. I am proud to have worked for such a supportive company
cons: Limited discipline and replacement of when employees don't pull their weight in your department. This creates extra work and less time off for others who do a good job.

job_title: Teacher Assistant in San Marcos, CA

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Escondido, CA
pros: I love my ESL students, so that's what keeps me there.  My co-workers and boss are great.
cons: Only 20% of the faculty are full-time, so good luck getting a full-time job.  I teach at night.  After 10 years, I've realized there is no room for advancement, so I'm looking for another job in the private sector.  Our raises do not even keep up with inflation.  The only benefits we get are sick leave and the option to buy health insurance.  Instructors are rarely asked their input.  Administration stays in their ivory tower.

job_title: Learning Assistant in San Marcos, CA
pros: It allowed me to gain experience with tutoring students one on one and in groups. It challenged me by having to go up in front of an entire class and cover tricky mathematical concepts.
cons: I struggled to deal with not always knowing the answer to every questions. Students expected a lot out of me and it made me feel bad whenever I was not able to give them the same amount of help as the teacher might have been able to.

review_title: It was a great experience because I learned a lot while helping other students learn.
job_title: Learning Assistant in San Mateo, CA
pros: The teacher I worked with was great. She made the job way more fun than it already was. It was challenging to always try and have the right answers for the students but she was there for support whenever I needed it.
cons: The hiring process was not fun. The employees within the Human Resources were unpleasant and difficult to get a hold of when I was trying to get all the unnecessary information about myself to them (such as fingerprints and what not).

review_title: Worked as a tutor there under the work study program
job_title: Math Tutor in San Marcos, CA
pros: It wasn't much of a stressful environment because most students were respectful & staff was reasonably flexible with choosing weekly schedule hours
cons: I would say I wished there was more hands-on training on the actual math curriculum we tutored for. Not only training on how to serve a very diverse community, which was actually very informative & eye-opening. Though it did teach us how to become better tutors & individuals in general in serving students of all kinds of backgrounds.

job_title: Supplemental Instruction Leader in San Marcos, CA
pros: The environment here is helpful and friendly. The goal of working here is to really help students learn and understand and it can be very rewarding.
cons: The administration, especially in the sciences, is way too overbearing.  They are involved in professional criticism of professors that is uncommon and completely counterproductive.

review_title: It's a good stepping stone and hopefully a resume booster toward education
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Marcos, CA
pros: It's a good place if you value education in society. It's one of the bigger CC's in North County SD. Campus is nice, people are generally nice.
cons: Pay is limited, hours are limited, no benefits (which is pretty much expected). Might take a long time for advancement as full-time positions are scarce these days.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in San Marcos, CA
pros: Very nice working conditions with generally fair-minded individuals. The campus is a pleasant place to be and the students are generally attentive and happy to me in class.
cons: The work is part-time only and the pay is better at other community colleges. Little is done to assure that adjuncts with seniority are given the best course options.

job_title: Computer Systems and Network Administration, Open Lab Supervisor in San Marcos, CA
pros: Friendly and collaborative atmosphere, excellent work environment, competitive pay. The Computer Science Department building is brand new and the computer labs get regular hardware upgrades.
cons: Sometimes internal documents and/or other internal issues get a lot of time to get approved or be resolved, but that is understandable for a public college.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Marcos, CA
pros: I worked with GEAR UP which is a tutoring program where they place us in local high schools to help our cohort students. I love it. It gave me an opportunity to tutor/advise students to achieve higher education. GU provides high school students multiple public or private universities field trips and many educational workshops encourage students to go to college.
cons: No raise in wages since it is grant funded program

review_title: So far great. It all depends on your department and go workers.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in San Marcos, CA
